programme.title: Get on Up: The Triumph of Black America S1 (2/2)
programme.desc: David takes us from the birth of hip-hop in the early 1980s to the present day.

programme.title: Panorama (The Drug Wars that Killed Olivia)
programme.desc: «The Drug Wars that Killed Olivia»Bronagh Munro examines how organised crime brought death to Olivia Pratt-Korbel's door.

programme.title: Parole S1 (4/4)
programme.desc: The board looks at the cases of a cocaine dealer and a man who bit another's ear off.

programme.title: This is BBC Two
programme.desc: Highlights of programmes on BBC Two.

programme.title: Hé, Oua-Oua (The Future Badge) S3 (n°15)
programme.desc: «The Future Badge»The Squirrels are taken to the future, which has a robot Duggee and other strange sights.

programme.title: Hé, Oua-Oua (Le badge Philosophie) S3 (n°16)
programme.desc: «Le badge Philosophie»Tino the Artistic Mouse inspires the Squirrels to think about life's big questions.

programme.title: Supertato (Double Doughnut Rescue) S1 (13/26)
programme.desc: «Double Doughnut Rescue»Supertato almost quits being a superhero when he can't save two friends at the same time.

programme.title: Shaun le mouton (Dangerous Deliveries) S5 (n°2)
programme.desc: «Dangerous Deliveries»Shaun decides to take on the role of Bitzer's therapist, with unexpected consequences.

programme.title: Denis et Scratch : déchaînés ! (Beat the Bus) S2 (n°1)
programme.desc: «Beat the Bus»New teacher Miss Mistry is taking Class 3C on a trip to Flumes o' Doom theme park.

programme.title: Boy, Girl, etc. (Dog Days) S2 (13/52)
programme.desc: «Dog Days»When Dog is housebound with an injured paw, Mouse links a teddy bear to Dog's mind.

programme.title: The Football Academy (Captain Fantastic) S1 (13/15)
programme.desc: «Captain Fantastic»U13s winger Remy is small for his age, and we see how the club help him play to his best.

programme.title: Organisation super insolite (Odd Beginnings) S3 (1/40)
programme.desc: «Odd Beginnings»Agents Opal and Omar uncover the location of a legendary odd artifact.

programme.title: OOglies Funsize (The One with the Banana Split Unicycle Talent Show) (1/20)
programme.desc: «The One with the Banana Split Unicycle Talent Show»Slippery Nana takes on a pizza-cutting unicycle in the talent show.

programme.title: One Zoo Three (Woodlands) (1/5)
programme.desc: «Woodlands»The OZT brothers go wild with red squirrels, bats, brown bears and wolves.

programme.title: Newsround
programme.desc: Topical news magazine for children.

programme.title: Blue Peter
programme.desc: Strictly winner Kelvin Fletcher joins us in the BP garden with some super-cute springtime animals, we meet a litter-busting organisation setting sail to prevent river litter, and Mwaksy teams up with some BP fans who love gardening with their grandparents!

programme.title: Mission pôle Nord pôle Sud (Special - Deadly Dinosaurs) (5/6)
programme.desc: «Special - Deadly Dinosaurs»Steve Backshall discovers the deadliest animals that ever walked the earth, the dinosaurs.

programme.title: Le tour du monde des petites bêtes
programme.desc: Patrick Aryee investigates what makes super small animals so successful.

programme.title: Jill Halfpenny's Easter Journeys S1 (2/2)
programme.desc: Actress Jill Halfpenny travels across the North East on a journey of discovery at Easter.

programme.title: Celebrity Best Home Cook S1
programme.desc: It's the quarter-final, and Mary Berry challenges the cooks to produce their ultimate celebration cake. The cakes can be any shape, size or flavour but must celebrate an event, and the type of event must be obvious from the design. For Chris Bavin's Rustle Up challenge, they are tasked with making the humble chickpea the star of their dishes. Then, Angela Hartnett sets one of her hardest eliminators to date, asking the cooks to produce three different Asian-inspired dishes within a very short space of time. At the end of a close blind tasting, the judges announce who will be leaving the competition and missing out on a place in the semi-final.

programme.title: Au rythme des saisons (Spring) S1 (1/4)
programme.desc: «Spring»Documentary celebrating spring on planet Earth and how animals and plants react to it.

programme.title: Talking Pictures
programme.desc: The career of Robert Redford, one of the big screen's greatest heartthrobs, is examined in this exploration of the BBC archives, with rarely seen interviews showing that he was always much more than just a pin-up. Narrated by Sylvia Syms.

programme.title: Butch Cassidy et le Kid
programme.desc: Paul Newman and Robert Redford play the most outrageous outlaws in western history.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Comedy. Detained at Her Majesty's pleasure, cellmates Fletcher and Godber become unwilling accomplices to an escape attempt in this cinema version of the popular BBC comedy.

programme.title: Easter from Kings
programme.desc: The traditional celebration of Easter with music and readings recorded in the candlelit Chapel of King's College, Cambridge, with the college's world-renowned choir under director Daniel Hyde. Members of the college will read from the King James Bible, and there is music from Bach, Mozart and Tchaikovsky. The service is led by the Dean, the Revd Dr Stephen Cherry.

programme.title: Dad's Army (Mum's Army) S4 (9/14)
programme.desc: «Mum's Army»Captain Mainwaring floats the idea of recruiting women to do the troop's menial tasks.

programme.title: Burt Bacharach: A Tribute from Ronnie Scott's
programme.desc: World-famous jazz club Ronnie Scott's hosts a tribute to Burt Bacharach - a songwriter, producer and pianist who was widely seen as one of the most important songwriters of the 20th century. Clive Myrie is at the show, which features brand new-jazz inspired arrangements of some of Burt Bacharach's best-loved music by the club's artistic director James Pearson. The setlist spans Burt Bacharach's epic career and includes The Look of Love, Alfie, Wives and Lovers, Do You Know the Way to San Jose and That's What Friends Are For.

programme.title: Burt Bacharach at the BBC
programme.desc: When Burt Bacharach passed away in February 2023 at the age of 94, the world said goodbye to one of the all-time songwriting greats. This celebration of the man and his music features a selection of the finest songs from his extraordinary back catalogue and some "magic moments" from the BBC's archives. With performances from artists like Aretha and Adele, Dusty and Dionne, Cilla Black and the White Stripes, this is a collection that highlights exactly why Burt was considered a legend by fans, critics and fellow artists, demonstrating once again the why he and his compositions are universally loved by "anyone who had a heart.".

programme.title: Burt Bacharach
programme.desc: Edith Bowman opens the Electric Proms 2008 in style, introducing legendary American songwriter Burt Bacharach at the Roundhouse in London's Camden Town. Accompanied by the BBC Concert Orchestra, he is joined on stage by some of Britain's finest home-grown talent: Adele, Beth Rowley and Jamie Cullum, who all ensure that this is an evening packed with classic, swooning tunes.

programme.title: Burt Bacharach at Glastonbury
programme.desc: Day two of the Glastonbury coverage sees the set by Burt Bacharach, the legendary singer and songwriter of countless classic songs from the late 1950s onwards, including 52 UK Top 40 hits. Back in 2000, Bacharach was unable to perform at the festival due to a shoulder injury, but now he finally makes his debut on the Pyramid stage to perform a selection of those classic tracks from his wonderful back catalogue.
